info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 1:41AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Granite and central Ravalli Counties through 230 AM MDT... At 140 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Darby, or 15 miles south of Hamilton, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain, winds in excess of 30 mph and half-inch size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Darby, Conner, Charlos Heights and Como. This includes Highway 93 S between mile markers 19 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
